API documentation¶

ChemPlot contains two modules: chemplot and descriptors. The former has only one class Plotter, to which the list of molecules is passed as a parameter in order to then use different functions for plotting. The module descriptors, instead, contains different functions, which are used used by the class Plotter during construction.

Plotter¶

class chemplot.chemplot.Plotter(encoding_list, target, target_type, sim_type, get_desc, get_fingerprints)[source]¶

A class used to plot the ECFP fingerprints of the molecules used to instantiate it.

construct_plot(x, y, size, kind, title, remove_outliers, is_colored, colorbar)[source]¶

Generates a plot for the given molecules embedded in two dimensions.

Parameters

  • x (string) – The first column of the dataframe containing the molecules

  • y (string) – The second column of the dataframe containing the molecules

  • size (int) – Size of the plot

  • kind (string) – Type of plot

  • title (string) – Title of the plot

  • remove_outliers (boolean) – Boolean value indicating if the outliers must be identified and removed

  • is_colored (boolean) – Indicates if the points must be colored according to target

  • colorbar (boolean) – Indicates if the plot legend must be represented as a colorbar. Only considered when the target_type is “R”.

Returns

The matplotlib axes containing the plot.

Return type

Axes

classmethod from_inchi(inchi_list, target=[], target_type=None, sim_type=None)[source]¶

Class method to construct a Plotter object from a list of InChi.

Parameters

  • inchi_list (dict) – List of the InChi representation of the molecules to plot.

  • target (dict) – target values

  • target_type (string) – target type “R” (regression) or “C” (classificatino)

  • sim_type (string) – similarity type structural or tailored

Returns

A Plotter object for the molecules given as input.

Return type

Plotter

classmethod from_smiles(smiles_list, target=[], target_type=None, sim_type=None)[source]¶

Class method to construct a Plotter object from a list of SMILES.

Parameters

  • smile_list (dict) – List of the SMILES representation of the molecules to plot.

  • target (dict) – target values

  • target_type (string) – target type “R” (regression) or “C” (classificatino)

  • sim_type (string) – similarity type structural or tailored

Returns

A Plotter object for the molecules given as input.

Return type

Plotter

pca(kind='scatter', size=20, remove_outliers=False, is_colored=True, colorbar=False)[source]¶

Calculates the first 2 PCA components of ECFP fingerprints and plots the data based on the result.

Parameters

  • kind (string) – Type of plot (default is scatter plot)

  • size (int) – Size of the plot (default size)

  • remove_outliers (boolean) – Boolean value indicating if the outliers must be identified and removed (default False)

  • is_colored (boolean) – Indicates if the points must be colored according to target

  • colorbar (boolean) – Indicates if the plot legend must be represented as a colorbar. Only considered when the target_type is “R”.

Returns

The matplotlib axes containing the plot.

Return type

Axes

tsne(perplexity=None, random_state=None, pca=False, kind='scatter', size=20, remove_outliers=False, is_colored=True, colorbar=False)[source]¶

Calculates the first 2 t-SNE components of ECFP fingerprints and plots the data based on the result.

Parameters

  • perplexity (int) – perplexity value for the t-SNE model

  • random_state (int) – random seed that can be passed as a parameter for reproducing the same results

  • pca (boolean) – Indicates that the data dimensionality must be first reduceded with PCA, before being reduced with t-SNE.

  • kind (string) – Type of plot (default is scatter plot)

  • size (int) – Size of the plot (default size)

  • remove_outliers (boolean) – Boolean value indicating if the outliers must be identified and removed (default False)

  • is_colored (boolean) – Indicates if the points must be colored according to target

  • colorbar (boolean) – Indicates if the plot legend must be represented as a colorbar. Only considered when the target_type is “R”.

Returns

The matplotlib axes containing the plot.

Return type

Axes

umap(n_neighbors=None, min_dist=None, random_state=None, kind='scatter', size=20, remove_outliers=False, is_colored=True, colorbar=False)[source]¶

Calculates the first 2 UMAP components of ECFP fingerprints and plots the data based on the result.

Parameters

  • n_neighbors (int) – Number of neighbours used in the UMAP madel.

  • min_dist (float) – Value between 0.0 and 0.99, indicates how close to each other the points can be displayed.

  • random_state (int) – random seed that can be passed as a parameter for reproducing the same results

  • kind (string) – Type of plot (default is scatter plot)

  • size (int) – Size of the plot (default size)

  • remove_outliers (boolean) – Boolean value indicating if the outliers must be identified and removed (default False)

  • is_colored (boolean) – Indicates if the points must be colored according to target

  • colorbar (boolean) – Indicates if the plot legend must be represented as a colorbar. Only considered when the target_type is “R”.

Returns

The matplotlib axes containing the plot.

Return type

Axes

descriptors¶

chemplot.descriptors.generate_ecfp(encoding_list, encoding_function, encoding_name, target_list, radius=2, nBits=2048)[source]¶

Calculates the ECFP fingerprint for given list of molecules encodings

Parameters

  • encoding_list (list) – List of molecules encodings

  • encoding_function (fun) – Function from rdkit.Chem used to translate the encodings into mol objects

  • encoding_name (string) – Name of the encoding

  • target_list (list) – List of target values

  • radius (int) – The ECPF fingerprints radius.

  • nBits (int) – The number of bits of the fingerprint vector.

Returns

The calculated ECPF fingerprints for the given molecules encodings

Return type

Dataframe

chemplot.descriptors.generate_mordred_descriptors(encoding_list, encoding_function, encoding_name)[source]¶

Calculates the Mordred descriptors for list of molecules encodings

Parameters

  • encoding_list (list) – List of molecules encodings

  • encoding_function (fun) – Function from rdkit.Chem used to translate the encodings into mol objects

  • encoding_name (string) – Name of the encoding

Returns

The calculated descriptors list for the given molecules encodings

Return type

Dataframe

chemplot.descriptors.get_ecfp(smiles_list, target_list, radius=2, nBits=2048)[source]¶

Parameters

  • target_list (list) – List of target values

  • radius (int) – The ECPF fingerprints radius.

  • nBits (int) – The number of bits of the fingerprint vector.

Returns

The calculated ECPF fingerprints for the given SMILES

Return type

Dataframe

  • target_list (list) – List of target values

  • radius (int) – The ECPF fingerprints radius.

chemplot.descriptors.select_descriptors_lasso(df_descriptors, target_list, R_select=0.05, C_select=0.05, kind='R')[source]¶

Selects descriptors by LASSO

Parameters

  • df_descriptors (Dataframe) – descriptors of molecules

  • target_list (list) – list of target values

  • R_select (float) – alpha value for Lasso

  • C_select (float) – C value for LogisticRegression

  • kind (string) – kind of target “R”->Regression “C”->Classification

Returns

The selected descriptors

Return type

Dataframe
